results.title: Let's go riding
results.creator_credit: Bill Latto and Town and Country Productions
results.brief_description: The progress story of a father and daughter whose visit to a riding school decides them to take up riding. As a result of further training at a pony club and a riding club they reach a sufficient standard to consider specialising in dressage, show jumping and cross country. The film also contains examples of top grade riding at national and international events.

results.title: Let's go gliding
results.brief_description: For centuries mankind has admired the soaring eagle and the effortless flight of the gull. While some aeronautical engineers perfect jumbo-jets and space probes, others continue to improve gliders for the sport of soaring. There is no cheaper form of flying. The fuel is solar energy, the motive forces are the thermal air currents triggered by the sun’s rays. Call it sport, or just plain enjoyment, it is an emulation of the bird. This is a celebration of soaring from the viewpoint of real people who are involved in the sport. Narrated by Ian Roache.

results.title: Lest we forget
results.creator_credit: Canadian Government Motion Picture Bureau and Photo-Sound Corporation
results.brief_description: This film was the first feature length documentary film with sound to be made in Canada. The production team compiled the film throughout the world and from Canadian cameramen who followed troops through training and into combat. Simulted battle scenes are also included. Part 1 - The story of Canadian military participation in WWI. A review is made of the major incidents that lead to declarations of war. Leading personalities are shown. Recruitment and training of soldiers takes place. Part 2 - The Battles of Mons, Ypres, the Somme, and Vimy Ridge. Part 3 - The Battle of Passchendaele. Sequences on the Royal Flying Corps in action on land and in the air. Dominion Day 1918 festivities among Canadian Armed Forces personnel at the front line near Vimy Ridge are captured on camera. End of the war celebrations and commemorations are shown. Exceptional material includes: Princess Patricia dedicating the Princess Patricia’s Canadian Light Infantry Regiment at Lansdowne Park, August 23, 1914; the sinking of the Szent Istvan, an Austro-Hungarian battleship, where sailors look like ants heaped up on one side and then jump into the sea; new military technology; war ruins and refugees; the American entry into the war; an observation balloon going up in flames; and Canadian railway troops building tracks. Canadian troops hold an Athletic Field Day on Dominion Day 1918; Canadian troops extinguish fires at Cambrai; the Prince of Wales in military uniform surrounded by other officers; soldiers in trenches, in marching formation, cheer news of the end of the war; funeral procession of nurses watch soldiers carry the coffins of nurses killed in an air raid of a hospital in France, May 1918. Officers salute the open grave. The Canadian troupe, The Dumbells, perform before Canadian troops on Dominion Day 1918. Compiled and edited by Frank C. Badgley and narrated by Rupert Caplan

results.title: Les Yeux Fermes = the Eyes Closed
results.brief_description:
Ivan returns from touring with a theatre company. During the tour one of Ivan’s friend died. Back in Paris, Ivan experiences vision toubles and buys a pair of black glasses. From then on, he starts pretending to be a blind man. His girlfriend Xenie witnesses helplessly the slow march towards madness of a ‘blind’ man whose only markers are noises and memories..

Credits: Director, Joel Santoni ; writer, Jeanne Bronner, Joel Santoni, Claude Breuer ; photography, Pierre-William Glenn ; music, Terry Riley.
Cast: Gerard Desarthe, Lorraine Rainer, Jean Carmet, Marcel Dalio, Lucien Raimbourg.

Please note this film contains mature themes, violence and nudity.

results.title: Les Sesterain Ou le Miroir 2000: Episode 9
results.brief_description:
During the summer season Francois who works with the Mountain Guides Association is called to rescue mountain climbers. The mission is a sucees but Francois is mortally injured during the operation. To the general surprise, Marie returns to the village to attend Francois’ funerals.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Long ; director, Francois Villiers ; writers, Andre Maheux, Francois Villiers ; photography, Paul Soulignac, Henri Raichi ; music, Francois de Roubaix.
Cast: Etienne Bierry, Jean-Claude Dauphin, Marie-Christine Barrault, Georges Claisse, Yves Lefebvre, Christian Alers, Marthe Villalonga, Marie-Helene Breillat.

results.title: Les Sesterain Ou le Miroir 2000: Episode 8

results.title: Les Sesterain Ou le Miroir 2000: Episode 7

The workmen’s hut is blown up causing heavy damage to Flandin’s cafe. Lauzon’s Landowners Union comes under suspicion, thus aggravating the rift between Antoine and the Union.

results.title: Les Sesterain Ou le Miroir 2000: Episode 6
results.brief_description:
It’s winter again at Le Miroir. Robert Flandin is back on the slopes, fulfulling all the hopes Francois has invested in his career. Pierre is still refusing to go to University, instead making vague plans to become a farner like his father. The tension between father and son runs high and Pierre decides to leave to work in a ski factory.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Long ; director, Francois Villiers ; writers, Andre Maheux, Francois Villiers ; photography, Paul Soulignac, Henri Raichi ; music, Francois de Roubaix.
Cast: Etienne Bierry, Jean-Claude Dauphin, Marie-Christine Barrault, Georges Claisse, Yves Lefebvre, Christian Alers, Marthe Villalonga, Marie-Helene Breillat.
